pages.name: DisagreePropertyDivision
pages.description:
The court may only make an order for ownership and possession of a companion animal by one spouse.

In determining whether to make an order in respect of a companion animal, the court must consider the following factors set out in section 97 (4.1) of the Family Law Act

elements.name: disagreeExistingPropertyDivisionDesciption
elements.html:
• the circumstances in which the companion animal was acquired
  • the extent to which each spouse cared for the companion animal
  • any history of family violence
  • the risk of family violence
  • a spouse’s cruelty, or threat of cruelty, toward an animal
  • the relationship that a child has with the companion animal
  • the willingness and ability of each spouse to care for the basic needs of the companion animal
  • any other circumstances the court considers relevant

elements.name: disagreeExistingCompanionAnimalOrder
elements.title: Why don’t you agree with the order requested by the other party about property division in respect of a companion animal?
elements.description: Explain why you do not agree with the other party’s requested order about property division in respect of a companion animal. You do not need to use any special wording. The key is to be clear about what you mean.

elements.name: disagreeExistingPropertyDivisionDesciption2
elements.html:
You have said you disagree with the property division in respect of a companion animal the other party is asking the court to order, now you can tell the court what you would like done.

You can ask the court to:
  • leave the existing agreement in place
  • eplace all or part of the existing agreement with a court order

elements.name: disagreeExistingPropertyDivisionDesciption3
elements.html: Remember the court may only make an order for ownership and possession of a companion animal by one spouse. Under section 97 of the Family Law Act, the court cannot declare that the spouses jointly own the companion animal, or require the spouses to share possession of the companion animal.

elements.name: existingOrderContinue
elements.title: Would you like the existing agreement about property division in respect of a companion animal to continue to be in place?

elements.name: replaceExistingAgreementChanges
elements.title: I am applying to replace the existing property division agreement in respect of a companion animal as follows:
elements.description: You do not need to use any special wording. The key is to be clear about the order you want the court to make instead. If you are asking for an order for ownership and possession of a companion animal, be sure to include the name of the companion animal and who you want to have ownership and possession of the animal.
